intro: Gilia debilis, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and purple, which bloom throughout the summer months. Gilia debilis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
